alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:46PM CDT until April 18 at 4:24PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... St. Croix River AT Danbury affecting Pine and Burnett Counties. .Light to moderate rain that fell earlier Saturday in Pine County on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of runoff. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast. * WHERE...St. Croix River AT Danbury. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to spread into picnic grounds near the gage near Highway 35. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Saturday was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain right around 7.0 feet through Sunday morning and then persist within Action Stage between 6.0 and 7.0 feet through Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.1 feet on 07/02/1958. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue St. Croix River Danbury 7.0 7.0 Sat 8 pm CDT 6.9 6.5 5.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon by 400 PM CDT.
